question: A 4-year-old boy is brought by his parents with the complaint that he frequently catches a cold and gets cough. According to the parents, he had pneumonia thrice this year and had to be admitted to the hospital one time. On examination, an ejection systolic murmur is heard on the left upper sternal border with a fixed splitting of the second heart sound. The first heart sound is loud. What is the most likely diagnosis?
'Sign of 3' is a feature of which congenital disease of the heart?
Which of the following pathologies is an indication for coronary artery bypass graft (CABG)?
Which vasculitis involves the aorta?
What is the length of nasogastric tube that should be inserted during gastric lavage?
Which of the following should not be used as an antidote for sulphuric acid?

answers.option: All of these can be used

question: Which of the following blood vessels return blood from the body to the heart?

answers.option: Pulmonary artery and inferior vena cava
Superior vena cava and inferior vena cava

question: Peripheral cyanosis occurs in which of the following pathologies?

answers.option: Congenital heart diseases (right to left shunt)

question: On autopsy, internal aspects of the stomach show brown folds and hardened esophagus. The acid involved will be:
Which is the most common organism responsible for infective endocarditis?
The exact spot where the QRS meets the ST-segment is known as:
A term infant is born with a large ventricular septal defect. Which congenital heart disease is most commonly associated with ventricular septal defect?
Which of the following is the hallmark feature of right sided heart failure?
A colorless, odorless volatile liquid that may acquire a yellowish tinge on exposure to air, with burning sour taste are the physical and chemical properties of which mineral acid?

A 42-year-old man comes to the emergency department with a history of taking liquids for suicide purpose. His pulse rate is 92/min and blood pressure is 120 /70 mmhg. He also has ulceration around the mouth and tongue. His chest is full of crepts and has severely labored breathing. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial step in management?
Which type of atrial septal defect (ASD) is commonly associated with atrioventricular (AV) canal defect?
A 25-year-old man complains of sharp pain which increases on lying down and is relieved with sitting. What is the diagnosis?
The nutmeg liver in congestive cardiac failure has gross changes. Which of the following is the most likely correct answer?

A 25-year-old patient with difficulty in breathing is diagnosed to have congestive heart failure. He is found to have differences in right and left arm pulses, diminished femoral pulses and notching of ribs on X-ray. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 50-year-old obese female complains about the shortness of breath after her trip to the USA. What is a possible diagnosis?
Which one of the following is considered as the principal preventive population strategy for cardiac disease?
Atrial septal defect is:

answers.option: A congenital, cyanotic defect between left and right atrium
Defect between ascending aorta and pulmonary artery
An acquired defect of mitral valve
A congenital, non-cyanotic defect between left and right ventricles
A congenital, non-cyanotic defect between left and right atrium

question: Which of these terms best describe echocardiography?
Which of these is the most common association with a patent ductus arteriosus?
What is the best method to prevent aspiration during gastric lavage in a comatose patient?

answers.option: Use of endotracheal tube prior to the lavage
Keeping the head lower than the legs
Keeping the patient in a sitting position

question: Which of these terms best describe angiography?
Which of these EKG changes are characteristic of atrial fibrillation?

answers.option: Absent P waves and irregular R-R intervals
Progressive lengthening of the PR interval
Absent P waves and regular R-R intervals

question: What is the first step in the management of an unstable patient with atrial fibrillation?

Why are nitrates preferred sublingually instead of the oral route?
A researcher wants to establish the prevalence of tuberculosis in Karachi. Which study design is most suitable for this?
Which of these is the best modality to confirm the diagnosis of mitral stenosis?

A 69-year-old man presents with chronic fatigue. He is a known cause of hypertension and a chest X-ray reveals bilateral pulmonary edema with a prominent left heart border. In line with this, what is the most appropriate description for his heart?
What is the most important clinical finding in the diagnosis of congenital heart diseases?
Which of these drugs can cause gynecomastia?
Which of these is the most common cause of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy?
Which antihypertensive has an initial hypertensive effect due to alpha 2 actions on the peripheral vasculature?
Which vasodilator drug is incorrectly paired with its mechanism of action?

A 7-month-old infant presents with short stature. He is at the 5th percentile for both height and weight. On examination, his temperature is 102 degrees celsius, and he is also tachycardia and tachypneic. He has a history of recurrent infections but there is no complaint of diarrhea. What is the most likely underlying etiology?
In cardiothoracic bypass surgery, where does the blood go after passing through the venous reservoir?
What is the most common type of cardiomyopathy?
A 56-year-old male presents with abdominal pain and peripheral edema. On examination, there is hepatomegaly as well as a positive shifting dullness. What are all these signs most indicative of?
Which of the following routes of administration is not used for nitroglycerin?
Which of the following drugs needs to be stopped if a woman is planning on conception?
Which of these is the most important diagnostic sound in the diagnosis of mitral stenosis?
A 30-year-old male presents to the office with a headache and heavy sweating. On examination, he is tachypneic and has increased blood pressure. What is the most likely cause?

answers.option: Hypertension secondary to adrenal cortex pathology

question: Which of these organisms is involved in rheumatic fever?

A 40-year-old male presents with complaints of increasing breathlessness, fatigue, and weakness for the last 2 months. He has a history of mediastinal Hodgkin lymphoma treated with radiation therapy 5 years ago. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of these types of antidotes combine with poisons to form new less toxic compounds?

Which one of these is a modifiable risk factor for the prevention of cardiovascular diseases?
Which of these is a non-modifiable risk factor in the context of cardiovascular diseases?
Which of these EKG characteristics define a third-degree atrioventricular block?

answers.option: AV dissociation and ventricular escape rhythm

A patient has an abdominal aortic aneurysm that was found on abdominal examination. Aneurysms are dilation of blood vessels. Which of the following is true about aneurysms?

answers.option: They involve the intima, media, and adventitia
They involve the intima and media

answers.option: It is a wedge shaped opening wound
It results from piercing with a pointed weapon
In this injury bruising around the opening of the wound is seen
It may occur with a knife

question: Which of these is closely related to the partially hydrogenated oils?
